title.narrative: Peace and Stabilisation Programme Horn of Africa 2018-2022

description.narrative: Denmark's Peace and Stabilisation Programme for the Horn of Africa 2018-2022 covers Ethiopia, Kenya and Somalia with a special focus on the ongoing conflict in Somalia, recognizing its regional consequences.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: FL §06.32.08.80 Global Framework for Integrated Stabilisation Efforts (development assistance)

title.narrative: Number of Member States that adopt, revise or retain an interest in legal frameworks, strategies and policies on maritime crime through discussion, training or technical assistance provided by UNODC
Number of Member States that adopt, revise or retain an interest in legal frameworks, strategies and policies on maritime crime through discussion, training or technical assistance provided by UNODC

target.value: 1 (SMRSS, egal training and or Standard Operation Procedures adopted per year)

actual.value: 2 , In 2021, the training on illegal fishing has been established as the response to the UNSCR2551. UNODC has engaged with the Ministry of Fishery and Maritime Resources (MOFMR), the Office of Attoney General as well as MMPU to establish the foundation of the coordination to tackle illegal fishing. Under this framework, 12 prosecutors were trained in theory and practice and 16 boarding officers of Maritime Police Unit and 3 fishery inspector of MOFMR were trained in the joint operation through both theoretical courses and practical courses including bording exercise in order to develop the inter-agency operational capacity.
Drafting Started
Drafting started

target.value: 2 (SMRSS, egal training and or Standard Operation Procedures adopted per year)

actual.value: finalization of legal framework still ongoing and UNODC continues to remain engaged. A virtual meeting led by the MOIS and with EUCAP, UNSOM, UNODC and Federal MPU's was scheduled to place however due to internal friction it was not possible.

Number of information packages on illicit Somali charcoal and other illicit trade (shipment, vessel identification, likely arrival points) made available to/shared between relevant international and regional agencies

Number of information packages on illicit Somali charcoal and other illicit trade (shipment, vessel identification, likely arrival points) made available to/shared between relevant international and regional agencies (8 research pieces, 2 briefings a year to international navies, 2 briefings a year for FGS and countries affected by the trade, 2 operational consultations a year, monthly briefings for relevant stakeholders at the embassy)

target.value: 8 research pieces. 2 briefings a year to international navies. 2 briefings a year for FGS and countries affected by the trade. 2 operational consultations a year. monthly briefings for relevant stakeholders at the embassy

actual.value: 32 expert consultations have been conducted and ad hoc delivery and sharing of information with the Gulf State authorities. Kenya Anti-Counterfeit Agency/ACA. Combined Maritime Forces (CMF). EUNAVFOR. UNMAS/UNEP. FAO. PoE and the UN Security Council.

target.value: 8 research pieces. 2 briefings a year to international navies. 2 briefings a year for FGS and countries affected by the trade. 2 operational consultations a year. monthly briefings for relevant stakeholders at the embassy

8 research pieces. 2 briefings a year to international navies. 2 briefings a year for FGS and countries affected by the trade. 2 operational consultations a year. monthly briefings for relevant stakeholders at the embassy

actual.value: Nil (No data reported by the project)

target.value: 8 research pieces. 2 briefings a year to international navies. 2 briefings a year for FGS and countries affected by the trade. 2 operational consultations a year. monthly briefings for relevant stakeholders at the embassy

actual.value: To support UNSCR 2551, UNODC convened and hosted nine (9) meetings with different international and regional agencies on disrupting illicit maritime flows into Somalia and within the East Africa region, during which international and national partners were briefed on UNODC’s Danish-funded research on crime areas and funding to a-Shabaab.

target.value: 8 research pieces. 2 briefings a year to international navies. 2 briefings a year for FGS and countries affected by the trade. 2 operational consultations a year. monthly briefings for relevant stakeholders at the embassy

actual.value: • 7 monthly quadrilateral meetings CMF-EUNAVFOR-POE-GMCP GARS • 1 ad hoc meeting (June) with CMF-EUNAVFOR-PoE discussing disruption and cooperation on the Somali charcoal. • 3 bilateral meetings (March-June) on different areas of illicit trade and maritime based TOC with CMF N2 (analysis unit). • 3 meetings (March-May) with Kenya ACA focal point (ACA Liaison to GMCP) about Brazil sugar. • Several meetings with POE to exchange information • 3 meetings (Feb-June) with Proscal/UNEP

title.narrative: Percentage of Somali Federal maritime law enforcement outside monsoon season that Somali Federal maritime law enforcement agencies patrol the territorial waters and the EEZ.
Percentage of Somali Federal maritime law enforcement outside monsoon season that Somali Federal maritime law enforcement agencies patrol the territorial waters and the EEZ.

actual.value: 13-14 hours per month
BPBMU every 3 days- patrolled for 4 hrs , MMPU patrolled 2 hours per day. SLCG patrolled 48 hrs per week They did not patrol in EEZ due to lack of assets

BPMPU have been patrolling their territorial waters 4 hours in every 3 days of the week. However, they did not patrol the EEZ due to lack of assets and capacities.
The SLCG have been patrolling their waters 48 hours per week.
The Mogadishu Maritime police unit on the other hand have been patrolling their territorial waters 2 hours per day.
Nil (No data reported for 2018)

actual.value: Nil (No data reported)

target.value: Information shared with all relevant somali Federal maritime law enforcement personnel

actual.value: Since January 2021, UNODC participated in 14 quadrilateral meetings, three of which it chaired, particularly in January, June, and November 2021. The monthly quadrilateral meetings are attended by EUNAVFOR, UN Panel of Experts on Somalia and Yemen and Combined Maritime Forces (CMF). UNODC briefed three Kenyan governmental agencies, namely the Agricultural and Food Authority (Sugar Directorate), the Border Management Secretariat (BMS), and the Government Chemist to raise awareness of sugar imports into Somali ports, which are illegally taxed by al-Shabaab and smuggled into Kenya. UNODC with the support of UNODC’s Office for the Gulf Cooperation Council Region, held a meeting in Dubai with the Executive Office of the Committee for Goods and Material Subjected to Import and Export Control, the Ministry of Defense, MOFAIC, MOI, Federal Customs Authority, General Authority for the Security of Ports, Borders and Free Zones and the Dubai Customs Authority. UNODC met with the Attorney Gener

title.narrative: Kenya and Somalia have increased law enforcement capacity to combat all forms of transnational organized crime at sea borders.
% of Somali Federal maritime law enforcement personnel trained to agreed operational capability for maritime law enforcement operations in the territorial sea and Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ)

actual.value: Bossaso: 14 Maritime Police officers. Mogadishu: Embedded mentorship of 35 MPU staff
Bossaso: 54 (including one female) Berbera: 71 Mogadishu: 5 (including one female)

Mogadishu: 85 officers trained in Marine Engineering, Communications system, Fishery Protection Bossaso: 38 officers trained in MLE, marine engineering and Communication Berbera: 16 officers trained in MLE, marine engineering and communications.
Nil - Project Starting

title.narrative: Number of border control facilities refurbished in Somalia and Kenya (port facilities, operation rooms)
Number of border control facilities refurbished in Somalia and Kenya (port facilities, operation rooms)

actual.value:
1, During the reporting period, UNODC delivered the communications infrastructure upgrade in Mogadishu through procurement of a new set of communications equipment for the Maritime Law enforcement forces in Mogadishu.
In Berbera and Bossaso, the local engineers have provided the much need training and mentoring of the units.
Refurbish work started

The mast refurbishment to upgrade the operations room at the Berbera Coast Guard base.
Refurbishing of a workshop facility is underway at the Berbera Coast Guard jetty area to facilitate repairs and maintenance of boats. A consignment of engines and spare parts was delivered to the Berbera, Bossaso and Mogadishu Maritime police units to help in maintenance of existing engines and boats in these ports.
